abstract: Editorial warns JPMorgan Chase’s weak earnings report suggests results from its peers are likely to be worse, since bank is one of nation's healthier ones; holds declines are worrisome because they reflect weakness of broader economy; questions whether lawmakers and regulators will stand up for new fee restrictions and other rules that banks resist.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase’s weak earnings report suggests results from its peers could be worse. That gloomy outlook reflects the economy and the failures of the banks themselves.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase’s weak earnings report suggests results from its peers could be worse. That gloomy outlook reflects the economy and the failures of the banks themselves.

headline.print_headline: The Banks Falter: A gloomy outlook on profits reflects the economy, but also bankers’ own failures
